business.headline: Volvo to slash 3,000 white-collar jobs in restructuring move: ReportA major portion of the cost-cutting will come from trimming white-collar roles, which account for around 40% of the company's total staff. Globally, the company has about 29,000 employees in Europe, 10,000 in Asia, and 3,000 in the Americas.

Borana Weaves share price: Stock extends gains after listing at 13% premiumWhile the listing price was above the issue price, it was slightly lower than what many expected. In the grey market, the stock had shown a premium of Rs 43-45 ahead of the listing, which suggested possible gains of around 20-22% on debut.

Good news for exporters as key tax refund scheme to return. Details hereThe Remission of Duties and Taxes on Exported Products (RoDTEP) scheme, which reimburses levies not covered by any other government programme, had been on hold since February 5 but will now resume.

IndiGo co-founder sells $1.36 billion of airline's shares: ReportThe shares were sold at 5,230.5 rupees ($61.35) each, the term sheet seen by Reuters showed, representing a discount of 3.5% to the company's closing price on Monday.

Explained: Why Sagility India Ltd shares fell 5% todaySagility India Ltd said it remains confident of steady performance through the next financial year. It expects growth supported by a strong balance sheet, a wide client base, and consistent business execution.

Sensex slumps 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 10:45 am, the BSE Sensex was down 838.64 points at 81,337.81, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 238.40 points to 24,762.75. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Olectra Greentech shares tumble nearly 7% in early trade. Here's whyThe stock, which has delivered over 2,250% returns in the last five years, has lost about a quarter of its value over the past year.

Sensex, Nifty fall sharply as markets break winning streak on profit bookingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 707.85 points to 81,468.60, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 225.40 points to 24,775.75 as of 9:30 am.

Explained: Why NSE unlisted shares hit an all-time highThe latest rally in NSE's unlisted shares signals strong appetite in the grey market, where expectations are running high for bumper gains once the IPO finally materialises.

Borana Weaves IPO: Will it list at a premium? Here's what GMP suggestsBorana Weaves share price: The Borana Weaves IPO opened for subscription on May 20 and closed on May 22. It was subscribed 147.85 times in total.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty continue its bull run today?Investors are feeling more confident due to early monsoon rains and the Reserve Bank of India's dividend payout to the central government.

Stocks to watch on May 27: IndiGo, LIC, FirstCry, Borana Weaves, Tata MotorsThe shares of Borana Weaves will be listed on the stock exchanges today. The IPO received strong interest from investors during its subscription period.

entertainment.headline: Unni Mukundan assaulted me, didn't like me praising Tovino's film: Former managerActor Unni Mukundan's former manager, Vipin Kumar, filed a complaint against him for abusing and assaulting him. Speaking to the media, Vipin claimed that the 'Marco' actor didn't like him praising actor Tovino Thomas's 'Narivetta'.

Sonu Sood's shirtless biker moment in Spiti backfires, police probe onA shirtless Sonu Sood is seen riding a bike without a helmet in the Spiti valley. The police commented on the video and announced that a probe was underway.

Salman Khan issues warning about smoking, fake friends with Sohail's new clipActor Salman Khan issued a cautionary warning about smoking and fake friends on Instagram. He shared a clip of his brother Sohail Khan smoking in what appears to be his upcoming project.

Arjun Kapoor mentions 'selfish people' in cryptic note, says it's 'in our DNA'Actor Arjun Kapoor shared a note about 'selfish people' on his Instagram story. He wrote a few lines in his stories and referred to people who don't 'show up' in need.

Bhool Chuk Maaf box office Day 4: Impressive 1st Monday for Rajkummar Rao's filmRajkummar Rao's 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' has surprisingly performed decently well at the box office despite mixed reviews. The film has now passed its Monday test as well.

Actor Nani calls Tourist Family gem of a film, director says his praise unexpectedTelugu actor Nani appreciated the Tamil film, 'Tourist Family', calling it a 'gem'. 25-year-old director Abishan Jeevinth was over the moon seeing Nani's praise.

'Is this your feminism?' Sandeep Vanga's jab amid row over Deepika's exit from filmFilmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed the 'dirty PR games' of an unnamed actor in a cryptic post on X. It was rumoured that Deepika Padukone was considered to play the female lead in his upcoming film, 'Spirit'. Later, the makers officially announced that Triptii Dimri had been on board.

'Duck Dynasty' star Phil Robertson dies at  79Phil Robertson, founder of Duck Commander and star of Duck Dynasty, has died at 79. The family plans a private service and public memorial. His faith and legacy touched millions.

Shakira falls on stage in Montreal during 'Whenever, Wherever' performanceShakira slipped onstage during her Montreal concert while performing "Whenever, Wherever" but quickly recovered. Fans praised her resilience. The incident follows a prior tour delay due to a health scare in February.

2025 AMAs: Full performer lineup, nominees, and ticket infoThe 2025 AMAs air May 26 from Las Vegas, hosted by Jennifer Lopez. With major performances, big-name nominees, and honors for Janet Jackson and Rod Stewart, it promises a star-studded celebration.

Captain America: Brave new world streaming on Disney+ starting May 28Captain America: Brave New World begins streaming on Disney+ May 28. Already a box office success, the Marvel blockbuster stars Anthony Mackie and features a star-studded cast in key roles.

Saif Ali Khan, Deepika Padukone, Diana Penty's Cocktail set for re-release in May'Cocktail,' featuring Saif Ali Khan, Diana Penty and Deepika Padukone in lead roles, is all set to return to the big screens. The film is directed by Homi Adajania.

Jennifer Aniston's 'sunday photo dump' features Hindu Goddesses Lakshmi and Durga'FRIENDS' star Jennifer Aniston uploaded multiple pictures on Sunday, one of which has grabbed the attention of her fans in India. The particular picture features idols of Hindu Goddesses Lakshmi and Durga, next to an idol of Laughing Buddha.

Abhishek Banerjee's award-winning crime-drama Stolen to release in June 2025Actor Abhishek Banerjee's film 'Stolen' is all set to release on Prime Video, two years after its debut at the Venice Film Festival. Anurag Kashyap, Kiran Rao, Nikkhil Advani and Vikramaditya Motwane have executive produced the crime-thriller.

Naveen Polishetty's Anaganaga Oka Raju set for Sankranthi 2026 release After multiple delays, the makers of 'Anaganaga Oka Raju' finally confirmed its release for Sankranthi 2026. The family entertainer stars Naveen Polishetty and Meenakshi Chaudhary.

Dhadak 2 release date out: Siddhant-Triptii's film to hit cinemas in AugustAfter facing many delays, 'Dhadak 2', starring Siddhant Chaturvedi and Triptii Dimri, is set to hit theatres. The film will be released in August this year.

Actor Simbu on Manchu Manoj: He's like a small kid, show him love, not angerAt the pre-release event of Bhairavam, Manchu Manoj called his friend, actor Simbu, during a live segment, leading to a candid and cheerful exchange.

Allu Aravind extends support to Pawan Kalyan, distances from exhibitors strikePushpa star Allu Arjun's father and producer Allu Aravind addressed speculations regarding his involvement in the ongoing exhibitor's strike in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh.

Raveena Tandon on alleged feud with Karisma Kapoor: It was classroom politicsActor Raveena Tandon recently recalled her catfight with Karisma Kapoor in the 90s on film sets. In a conversation with Farah Khan on her Vlog, Raveena called it, 'classroom politics.'

general news.headline: Suicide pact? 6 of family found dead in car, 7th says 'will die in 5 minutes'In a video that has surfaced showing the man's final moments, locals can be heard saying, 'Give him some water,' while others are heard calling local authorities to come to the spot immediately. The family took this extreme step as they were in heavy debt and financial distress, according to locals present at the scene.
Op Sindoor: New video shows how India hit Pak army posts, sent Rangers fleeingOp Sindoor: India hit terror hubs 2.2 km inside Pak, blew up army post, video shows

Want to resolve all disputes: In Iran, Pak PM says ready to hold talks with IndiaDuring a visit to Tehran, Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif expressed willingness to hold peace talks with India to resolve key bilateral issues, including Kashmir, terrorism, water sharing, and trade.

Why Indian cities get submerged overnight. No, it's not just rainIndian cities get submerged overnight, and that's not just because of heavy rains. A deadly combination of unplanned urban growth and inadequate infrastructure amplifies urban flooding. To make matters worse, climate change–induced shifts in seasonal rainfall patterns have made urban flooding a harsh reality for Indian cities.

'Is this your feminism?' Sandeep Vanga's jab amid row over Deepika's exit from filmFilmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga slammed the 'dirty PR games' of an unnamed actor in a cryptic post on X. It was rumoured that Deepika Padukone was considered to play the female lead in his upcoming film, 'Spirit'. Later, the makers officially announced that Triptii Dimri had been on board.

India hires Trump's brain for lobbying, Pakistan his ex-bodyguardIn what seems like a clash of brain and brawn, India has tapped Trump's senior adviser, Jason Miller, and a communication strategist, while Pakistan has recruited Keith Schiller, the US President's long-time bodyguard. Schiller has been famous for delivering both resignation letters and punches on behalf of Trump. Here's more.

Nakal karne ke liye akal chahiye: Asaduddin Owaisi roasts Pak over fake photoAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi mocked Pakistan for using a 2019 Chinese military drill photo as fake evidence of victory over India. He urged people not to trust Pakistan's claims.
Man dies as bomb he tried to plant in Amritsar explodes in his handAmritsar blast: Cops are probing whether the incident was part of a larger plot or an isolated event.

Men without women forcing China to smuggle wives from Bangladesh, NepalChina's gender imbalance has birthed a shadow industry of bride-trafficking, where poor women from several Asian countries, including Bangladesh, Nepal and Myanmar, are lured with false promises and then "sold" as "wives" to rural Chinese men. These women, desperate for a better life, end up being confined, raped, and forced into childbirth.

Amazon Fashion's 'SERVE' Store Offers Convenience, Selection and Value to Gen Z, says Nikhil Sinha, Director, Amazon FashionIndia's first dedicated Gen Z fashion store democratizes style access across the country with 3X customer growth

Rain fury in Kerala, Maharashtra; Karnataka on alert, east braces for delugeWith a low-pressure system building in the Bay of Bengal and monsoon currents strengthening, eastern states are bracing for the heavy rain onslaught. Meanwhile, a red alert has been sounded in coastal Karnataka and parts of Kerala.

Just joking around: Macron plays down viral video of wife shoving him on planeSpeaking to reporters after the clip went viral, Macron clarified that the exchange with his wife was being misunderstood and blamed disinformation efforts for distorting what he called a light-hearted moment.

Sonu Sood's shirtless biker moment in Spiti backfires, police probe onA shirtless Sonu Sood is seen riding a bike without a helmet in the Spiti valley. The police commented on the video and announced that a probe was underway.

Haryana mass suicide victims had Rs 20 crore debt, got death threats: RelativeHailing from Barwala in Hisar, Praveen had shifted to Panchkula 12 years back. He owned a scrap factory in Himachal Pradesh, which was later seized by the bank due to unpaid loans, according to Praveen's cousin Sandeep Agarwal.

Trump asking for investment? Karnataka people duped of lakhs using AI videoAI-generated visuals of US President Donald Trump were used to promote a fake hotel rental scheme, duping several people across Karnataka. Cybercriminals behind the fraudulent "Trump App" lured victims with promises of high returns, leading to losses worth crores of rupees.

Sensex slumps 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?At 10:45 am, the BSE Sensex was down 838.64 points at 81,337.81, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 238.40 points to 24,762.75. Broader market indices also faced selling pressure, with heightened volatility dragging down sentiment across the board.

Why some Covid-19 cases turn severe while others don'tA new study finds that the Covid-19 virus can reprogram immune cells to weaken the body's defence. This discovery could lead to treatments that boost immunity in severe cases.

Video: Terrifying moment when car ploughed into Liverpool parade crowd, 50 injuredA speeding car drove into crowds celebrating Liverpool's Premier League win. A video has captured the moment of impact. The incident injured several people. A British man has been arrested.
Tejashwi Yadav, wife Rajshree welcome second childRJD leader and former Bihar Deputy Chief Minister Tejashwi Yadav and his wife Rajshree Yadav welcomed their second child, a son, on Tuesday.
Meerut man arrested after video shows him spitting on rotis at roadside eateryA Meerut man was arrested after a viral video showed him spitting on rotis at a roadside eatery.
Taking a shower twice a day, but still breaking out? What you might be missingSweaty summer days often lead to more shower time. But there is a catch when it comes to frequent rinse and repeat.

IBM is cutting around 8000 jobs likely because of AI, major losses in HR departmentIBM has laid off around 8,000 employees and the majority of the losses will reportedly be from the HR department. The cause? AI.

J&K cop threatens suicide over salary, climbs tree, rescued by MLA after 5 hoursAn MLA from Jammu and Kashmir had to be called in to rescue an SPO from J&K Police, who climbed a tree in Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie for nearly five hours and threatened to kill himself over a cut in his salary.

'He's my husband, not driver': Polish woman slams stereotypes she faced in IndiaIn a now-viral video post on Instagram, a Polish woman slammed stereotypes she faced in India, as locals often mistook her husband for a driver.

sports.headline: BCCI to honour Indian Armed forces during IPL 2025 closing ceremonyThe BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) will be paying a special tribute to the Indian armed forces during the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) closing ceremony, confirmed BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia.

LSG vs RCB, IPL 2025 Preview: Can Bengaluru finish top-2 after 9 years?LSG vs RCB, IPL 2025 Preview: RCB enter their final league match of IPL 2025 with top-two ambitions alive, but face a pride-fuelled LSG in tricky Lucknow conditions. Hazlewood's return and dew factor could heavily influence the outcome.

Jannik Sinner thanks best goalkeeper Donnarumma for attending French Open matchJannik Sinner began his French Open campaign with a straight-sets win over Arthur Rinderknech, extending his Grand Slam streak and acknowledging the presence of PSG goalkeeper Gianluigi Donnarumma in the crowd.

Rishabh Pant is victim of bad timing in IPL 2025: Akash Deep LSG pacer Akash Deep feels that his captain Rishabh Pant, is a victim of "bad timing" in his career, which explains his woeful form this season. He added that it's not so much a case of pressure affecting Pant, as the captain is well accustomed to playing top-flight cricket.

PBKS manifested, believed and worked hard for top two finish: Shashank SinghPunjab Kings' (PBKS) batter Shashank Singh revealed that their team manifested a top two finish right after the auction and worked hard towards it. Punjab qualified for the IPL playoffs after 11 years and guaranteed a top-two finish, following their 7-wicket win over Mumbai Indians (MI) in their last fixture in Jaipur.

Told Priyansh Arya would be the find of IPL 2025, hard to argue now: PontingIPL 2025: Priyansh Arya delivered a match-winning knock against Mumbai Indians, validating Ricky Ponting's early-season prediction of him being a breakout star. The young batter's consistency and composure have been key to Punjab Kings securing a top-two finish in IPL 2025.

PBKS loss not the end of the world, we'll bounce back in Eliminator: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that the team isn't too worried about their loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their last fixture and backed them to bounce back strongly in the Eliminator. PBKS beat MI by seven wickets in their last league fixture in Jaipur.

French Open 2025, Day 3 Order of Play: Djokovic, Zverev and Gauff begin campaignDay 3 at the Roland Garros 2025 will feature several big names starting their campaign as Novak Djokovic, Alexander Zverev, Coco Gauff and Jessica Pegula, amongst others will begin their campaign.

Mumbai Indians got outplayed by Punjab Kings, fell 20 runs short: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' (MI) wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton rued his team's batting performance after their seven-wicket hammering against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 69 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Won't be easy for Virat, Rohit to maintain fitness for ODIs: Anil KumbleLegendary spinner Anil Kumble said that while it won't be easy for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma—who will continue playing ODI cricket—to maintain their fitness levels, the two stalwarts should be celebrated for the remainder of their careers.

Shashank Singh reacts to viral podcast clip after PBKS seal top 2 spot in IPL 2025PBKS vs MI: Punjab Kings secured a top-two finish in IPL 2025, fulfilling Shashank Singh's pre-season prediction and earning a spot in Qualifier 1. He credited the team's success to the strong culture and unity fostered by captain Shreyas Iyer and coach Ricky Ponting.

PBKS loss not the end of the world, we'll bounce back in Eliminator: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton said that the team isn't too worried about their loss against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in their last fixture and backed them to bounce back strongly in the Eliminator. PBKS beat MI by seven wickets in their last league fixture in Jaipur.

Mumbai Indians got outplayed by Punjab Kings, fell 20 runs short: Ryan RickeltonMumbai Indians' (MI) wicketkeeper batter Ryan Rickelton rued his team's batting performance after their seven-wicket hammering against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Match 69 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Won't be easy for Virat, Rohit to maintain fitness for ODIs: Anil KumbleLegendary spinner Anil Kumble said that while it won't be easy for Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma—who will continue playing ODI cricket—to maintain their fitness levels, the two stalwarts should be celebrated for the remainder of their careers.

He credited the team's success to the strong culture and unity fostered by captain Shreyas Iyer and coach Ricky Ponting.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
